description: APPLICATION FOR THE ADVERTISEMENT CONSENT FOR THE DISPLAY OF THE UPGRADE OF EXISTING 48 SHEET ADVERT TO SUPPORT DIGITAL POSTER
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - This consent shall expire 5 years from the date of this decision.
Condition : 2 - No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

Condition : 3 - No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military), obscure or hinder the ready interpretation of any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.
Condition : 4 - Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.
Condition : 5 - Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.
Condition : 6 - Where an Advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 
- Drawing No. 0124_2403 PA 01 
- Drawing No. 0124_2403 PA 02 
- Drawing No. 0124_2403 PA 03 
- Drawing No. 0124_2403 PA 04 
- Drawing No. 0124_2403 PA 05 
- Drawing No. 0124_2403 PA 06

Condition : 8 - The proposed signage must not have any intermittent light source, moving feature, animation or exposed cold cathode tubing. 

Reason: To ensure advertisements do not become a distraction, in the interests of the pedestrian and highway safety and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D5, DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 9 - The proposed advertisement sheet should operate at an illumination level no greater than 300cd/m2 between dusk and dawn, consistent with the guidance set out in the Institute of Lighting Professionals (ILP) publication: "The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements" (PLG05, January 2015).

Reason: To ensure advertisements do not become a distraction, in the interests of the pedestrian and highway safety and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D5, DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 10 - The minimum display time for each advertisement shall be 5 seconds, the use of message sequencing for the same product is prohibited and the advertisements shall not include features/equipment which would allow interactive messages/advertisements to be displayed. 

Reason: To ensure advertisements do not become a distraction, in the interests of the pedestrian and highway safety and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D5, DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 11 - The interval between successive displays should be instantaneous (0.1 seconds or less), the complete screen should change, there should be no visual effects (including fading, swiping or other animated transition methods) between successive displays and the display should include a mechanism to freeze the image in the event of a malfunction. 

Reason: To ensure advertisements do not become a distraction, in the interests of the pedestrian and highway safety and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D5, DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 12 - The footway and carriageway of the A24 Christchurch Road must not be blocked during works to install the advertisement. Temporary obstructions during the installation works must be kept to a minimum and should not encroach on the clear space needed to provide safe passage to pedestrians or obstruct the flow of traffic on the A24 Christchurch Road.

Condition : 13 - All vehicles associated with the installation of the advertisement must only park/ stop at permitted locations and within the time periods permitted by existing on street restrictions.

Condition : 14 - No skips or construction materials shall be kept on the footway or carriageway of the TLRN at any point. Should the applicant wish to install scaffolding on the footway of the A24 Christchurch Road whilst undertaking works to install the advertisement, this will be subject to a separate Section 169 licence application under the Highways Act 1980 to the Asset Operations Team at TfL. For more information please go to https://www.tfl.gov.uk/info-for/urban-planning-and-construction/highway-licences.
